data.label: Data to Insight
data.summary: A sector‑led service for local authority children’s data professionals. Led by LAs, supported by ADCS, DfE, DLUHC, Ofsted. Maintains toolkits, shares best practice, and enables national collaboration (DDSF, RCC, NVEST, PATCh, Standard Safeguarding Dataset).
data.search_blob: data to insight data_tools children_services a sector‑led service for local authority children’s data professionals. led by las, supported by adcs, dfe, dluhc, ofsted. maintains toolkits, shares best practice, and enables national collaboration (ddsf, rcc, nvest, patch, standard safeguarding dataset). organizations/data_to_insight organization
data.notes: Collaboration hub for scalable data improvement work in the public sector, especially children’s services. Known for its open, tool-based approach and partnership with government and local authorities.

data.label: East Sussex County Council - Children's Services
data.summary: The local authority responsible for children's social care, safeguarding, early help, and family support services across East Sussex. Delivers statutory and preventative services to support children, young people, and families.
data.search_blob: east sussex county council - children's services local_authority childrens_services safeguarding east_sussex early_help send care_leavers fostering adoption the local authority responsible for children's social care, safeguarding, early help, and family support services across east sussex. delivers statutory and preventative services to support children, young people, and families. organizations/east_sussex_county_council organization
data.notes: Upper-tier local authority in the South East of England with statutory responsibility for children’s social care and family support. Children’s Services includes safeguarding and child protection, early help, support for children in care and care leavers, fostering and adoption, residential care, kinship care, services for children and young people with special educational needs and disabilities (SEND), and targeted support for families facing financial or social hardship. Works in partnership with health, police, education, and the voluntary sector through the East Sussex Safeguarding Children Partnership (ESSCP).

data.label: Data and Digital Solutions Fund (DDSF)
data.summary: Funding stream to support local data innovations for children’s services.
data.search_blob: data and digital solutions fund (ddsf) d2i data_improvement ddsf1a ddsf1b funding stream to support local data innovations for children’s services. plans/ddsf plan
data.notes: DDSF was established to help local authorities invest in data infrastructure and innovation. Multiple projects under the DDSF banner contributed to tools such as NVEST, SSD, and RCC.

data.label: FFP Programme Guide 2025
data.summary: The FFC pathfinder was announced in February 2023 as part of the government’s children’s social care implementation strategy, stable homes, built on love.
data.search_blob: ffp programme guide 2025 family_group_decision_making early_intervention practice_guide the ffc pathfinder was announced in february 2023 as part of the government’s children’s social care implementation strategy, stable homes, built on love. plans/ffp_programme_guide_2025 plan
data.notes: From July 2023 to March 2025, the programme is investing over £45 million to design and test radical reforms in a number of local areas, across the following policies:  family help, child protection, family networks, safeguarding partners. The pathfinder draws on evidence and existing good practice, including from other government programmes: family hubs and start for life, supporting families, reducing parental conflict, strengthening families, protecting children

data.label: NVEST
data.summary: (National Voice for Excellence in Safeguarding Technology) NVEST is a network for systems managers and social work professionals working to manage, maintain, procure, and improve case management systems and other technologies for social work. It is funded by D
data.search_blob: nvest nvest value_for_money children_services dlucl effectiveness (national voice for excellence in safeguarding technology) nvest is a network for systems managers and social work professionals working to manage, maintain, procure, and improve case management systems and other technologies for social work. it is funded by d plans/nvest plan
data.notes: NVEST is part of Data to Insight's support offer and supports benchmarking, impact tracking, and funding evidence across local authorities.

data.label: Kinship Care Strategy
data.summary: First-ever national strategy enabling more children to stay with kinship carers, with £20 million invested to support educational, financial, and practical reforms.
data.search_blob: kinship care strategy kinship_care social_care_reform policy national_strategy first-ever national strategy enabling more children to stay with kinship carers, with £20 million invested to support educational, financial, and practical reforms. plans/national_kinship_care_strategy plan
data.notes: Strategy sets out long-term support for kinship families, including trials of financial allowances, Virtual School Head support, and legal reform pathways. Developed with kinship carers, LA partners, and expert input.

data.label: Special Educational Needs and Disabilities (SEND) Services - East Sussex
data.summary: East Sussex SEND Services provide statutory assessment, planning, and support for children and young people aged 0-25 with special educational needs and disabilities. Information and access to SEND support is primarily provided through the East Sussex Local Of
data.search_blob: special educational needs and disabilities (send) services - east sussex send special_educational_needs disabilities ehcp childrens_services education social_care east sussex send services provide statutory assessment, planning, and support for children and young people aged 0-25 with special educational needs and disabilities. information and access to send support is primarily provided through the east sussex local of services/east_sussex_county_council_childrens_services_send service
data.notes: The East Sussex Local Offer is the statutory information service for SEND, providing details of education, health and social care support available for children and young people with special educational needs and disabilities. SEND Services work in partnership with families, schools, health providers, and voluntary organisations, including independent advice services such as Amaze SENDIASS.

fields.scope: Statutory SEND assessment and planning, SEND support services, coordination with education providers, and multi-agency working to support inclusion and positive outcomes for children and young people with SEND.

data.label: Standard Safeguarding Dataset (SSD)
data.summary: A Department for Education-funded initiative led by Data to Insight, working with Hertfordshire CC, Essex CC, Knowsley Council and North West ADCS to create a standardised dataset for children’s social care data sharing and outcomes tracking. Based on the SSD
data.search_blob: standard safeguarding dataset (ssd) ssd data_standard safeguarding dfe_funded ddsf ddsf1a systemc mosaic tag azeus eclipse olm sql python a department for education-funded initiative led by data to insight, working with hertfordshire cc, essex cc, knowsley council and north west adcs to create a standardised dataset for children’s social care data sharing and outcomes tracking. based on the ssd services/standard_safeguarding_dataset service
data.notes:
SSD defines a common schema layered on local authority systems. Open-source schema maintained via public repository and updated through partner feedback and implementation experience. 
access_url: https://www.datatoinsight.org/publications-1/standard-safeguarding-dataset---final-report

fields.scope: To create a nationally consistent dataset for safeguarding data collection and use across local authorities, with a focus on interoperability, transparency and analytics.

data.label: Children's Wellbeing and Schools Bill 2024–25
data.summary: Legislation covering safeguarding, support for children in or leaving care, regulation of care workers, breakfast clubs, attendance, and more.
data.search_blob: children's wellbeing and schools bill 2024–25 legislation safeguarding social_care legislation covering safeguarding, support for children in or leaving care, regulation of care workers, breakfast clubs, attendance, and more. events/childrens_wellbeing_schools_bill_2024_25 event
data.notes: Introduced in Parliament December 2024. Proposes statutory measures related to children's welfare, education provision, and system-wide safeguarding responsibilities.

data.label: Methodology Report Children's Social Care in England 2025
data.summary: Quality and methodology documentation supporting Ofsted's annual data publication on children's social care providers, inspections and outcomes in England.
data.search_blob: methodology report children's social care in england 2025 social_care methodology statistics quality and methodology documentation supporting ofsted's annual data publication on children's social care providers, inspections and outcomes in england. events/childrens_social_care_in_england_2025 event
data.notes: This methodology report accompanies Ofsted’s annual release of data and findings. It outlines data sources, inspection processes, and interpretation guidance for national statistics users.

data.label: Children's Social Care Review
data.summary: An independent review commissioned by the Department for Education to evaluate the state of children's social care in England and propose system-wide reforms to improve outcomes for children and families.
data.search_blob: children's social care review social_worker an independent review commissioned by the department for education to evaluate the state of children's social care in england and propose system-wide reforms to improve outcomes for children and families. events/childrens_social_care_review event
data.notes: Led by Josh MacAlister, with contributions from Karen Broadhurst and others. The review informed major reform proposals including the National Framework and investment priorities.
